metadata.name: Bauhaus art #red #65
metadata.description:
Bauhaus art #red

I have designed this collection with red color, the color of the blood of the innocents who rose up for freedom
Bauhaus style by combining lines and combining them
and red theme
In 5 layers
2 layers of cover and background
And 3 layers of designs, each of which has about 12 images

Blood is red, but when it falls on the ground, a tree is white
In the name of freedom
It is born from it!

metadata.name: Coiling 1 #215
metadata.description:
Coiling 1 is an experiment in generative weaving to create a series of baskets. This weaving experiment employs a cellular automata (CA) system to produce a weave across a sphere that is defined by a distribution of points or cells. The CA algorithm is a rule-set based on binary values that structure the decision-making process for each node in the pattern. It produces an intricate and almost endless variety of weaves because the algorithm automatically feeds information back to itself to make the next decision. This causes the weave to adapt and change as it travels over the surface.

Description of Coiling 1 and its unique Features:
1. The grey sphere you see is a Basket made up of coiling rings.
2. Each Basket grows from a randomized initial condition.
3. From there the coiling continues to expand from 256 possible rules of growth, building up each basket ring by ring.
4. Each token generates multiple baskets. There is a 50% chance of generating 3 baskets, a 30% chance of 6 baskets, and a 20% chance of 9 baskets.
5. Given the generative logic, the basket patterns are practically unique. The possibility of repeating is near zero. 
6. Having said that, the Coiling 1 logic has certain tendencies in the types of patterns it produces relating to tightness, opacity and complexity of the coiling weave.

Navigation Instructions:
1. Type “n” to change Coiling Pattern and create a new basket.
2. Left or Right arrow to toggle between different views. Keep toggling to go inside the basket. 
3. Left click + drag to spin around, right click + drag to zoom.
4. “i” saves view as png.

metadata.name: Perspective #40
metadata.description:
A few primitives and a lot of points.

Warning: This piece is GPU intensive, it may not render on lower end devices.

Keys
s: Take a screenshot
space: Pause/Play the animation.
r: Play a new animation
↑: Increase point alpha
↓: Decrease point alpha
→: Increase point density
←: Decrease point density

URL Params
w: Width of the canvas - (ex, w=1024) - [0-2048]
h: Height of the canvas - (ex, h=1024) - [0-2048]
a: To set the alpha for the points - [0.0-1.0]
p: To set the total number of points to draw (in millions) [1-8]
s: Make the visual static - (ex, s=1)

metadata.name: Crash Euphoria #16
metadata.description:
My first foray into shaders and GLSL: This piece experiments with layering many textures guided by an underlying pattern. Each pixel value dictates which pattern is displayed. There are varying levels of imperfections in each pattern, some choose a single color, some use a color guide pattern, some individual strokes decide on another color altogether. These layers are compiled in a shader and warped.

Press 's' in live view to save a png

Created with p5.js and chroma.js

metadata.name: tratti #144
metadata.description:
"tratti" is an Italian word that has many different meanings. When we started working on this piece, we wanted to create something that combines our traits ("tratti" in Italian).
We had this urge to channel the turbulent times we're living in now into this artwork using just lines ("tratti" in Italian).

We don't know what to do now, we're here, and that's all that matters. We're here for our families, our friends, and our community. Like everything in life, there are joyful times and challenging times. We must accept happiness as something that is not constant but that we feel at times (a "tratti" in Italian).

With "tratti", we want to send a message to every disheartened human being: "Stay strong and never let anyone or anything crush the hope in you. Joyful times are around the corner".

---- 

© 2022 — Alessandro Fiore x Emanuele Pasin
LICENSE.md for detailed licensing info

metadata.name: Poems in the Public Domain #52
metadata.description:
POEMS IN THE PUBLIC DOMAIN [PITPD] represents a new form of poetic anthology—one that celebrates the role of the reader in shaping the life of a poem. In this unique art piece, 14 readers take turns discovering 30 classic poems. We invite collectors to explore this compendium, selected to present a diverse, engaging archive that acknowledges the importance of certain seminal works in shaping our collective unconscious. 

Inspired by Roland Barthe's maxim, "those who fail to reread are obliged to read the same story everywhere," each reader is represented by multiple pen colors & new marginalia, suggesting the crucial act of rereading. 

The verses vanish, just like our memory of their exact words might fade, but distilled, standout moments of personal connection remain. In time, even these wane, providing a scarcely perceptible backdrop as the poem is discovered & interpreted anew. 

PITPD explores authorship. When a poem enters the public domain, it no longer belongs to its author but to its readers. In the intimate moments we read a poem, we link it to our private, pulsating worlds & help ensure others will read it, too. If history’s palms hadn’t held Sappho’s words, our fingers wouldn’t hold them now. 

Readers write poetry’s survival. 

Each iteration of PITPD traces a narrative that can play for hours without repeating. Some 89% of iterations chronicle the life of a single poem, while 11% include multiple poems, intentionally surveying intertextuality. Taking advantage of the generative medium, embodied readership is represented via dynamic handwriting, dancing markings, algorithmic paper aging, coded stains, & other effects.

Spacebar pauses & resumes the animation. Refreshing the browser window restarts it. For those interested in the underlying code, please open the browser console. This collection’s ciphers, too, are in the public domain.

Additional information can be found in the companion article on fx(text): fxhash.xyz/article/poems-in-the-public-domain-marginalia-as-living-verse

metadata.name: Right Click Hash #2
metadata.description: An Generative art experiment Inspired by Right Click Share

metadata.name: 🌶️ HOT PEPPER GANG 🌶️ #32
metadata.description:
Say hello to the 🌶️ HOT PEPPER GANG 🌶️ 

The 🌶️ HOT PEPPER GANG 🌶️ is a profile picture project by FILTER8 released under his alias Drawvolution for the PICANTE Community Event on Tezos.

Picante is the Spanish word for Spicy. So what's Hot & Spicy? Right a hot pepper. 

FILTER8 challenged himself with releasing a 8x8 px 🌶️ embedded on a 24x24 px background to give the 🌶️  more room. The 🌶️ consists of 5 Layers: Location (3), Pulp (20), Personality (9), Mouth (7), Crown (10). He used his signatures Win95 retro color palette of 16 colors to design the artworks.  

🎁 BONUS: After the mint the top 5 🌶️ HOT PEPPER GANG 🌶️ Collectors will get one of their PFP airdropped as a 8x8 on-chain version on 8bidou, the on-chain pixel marketplace on Tezos.


👉 Join the the 🌶️ HOT PEPPER GANG 🌶️ and get spicy 


🌶️ Hot Pepper Size 8x8 px
🌶️ Canvas Size: 24x24 pixel
🌶️ Format: .png
🌶️ Layers: 5
🌶️ Traits: 46
🌶️ One 8x8 on-chain HOT PEPPER Version included for the 5 top collectors.

🌶️ Thanks to PureSpider for this spicy code.

metadata.name: Diyalebuka #110
metadata.description:
Diyalebuka - "Thank you"! 

With this piece I hope to express my thanks and joy for being alive and able to create art. I hope the patterns and textures will bring you joy.

This piece is inspired by the patterns of the Ndebele of Southern Africa and the First Nations Salish of Vancouver Island.

* There are over 100 palettes arranged into 6 distinct families
* There can be between 2 and 10 bars

(The artwork will fit your available window and may take a while to generate if it's a larger resolution)

metadata.name: GEN XYZ Das Occult #6679
metadata.description:
A 10k Generative Profile Pic collection
GEN XYZ Das Occult - by culla - @tamccullough

move over cryptopunks
there is a new group on the scene

100% code - not an image composition

A bunch of common palettes
A selection of rare palettes
And a smaller set of ultra rare palettes
However, rarity will be based on what combinations the code produces

The majority of tokens will not have a special trait
However your token might have one or even multiple special traits
But, be aware that only the last special trait added will be listed in the features

Even then, look closely, because not all aspects of the canvas are included in the features. Collectors should still look closely and choose what they like when buying on secondary.

Which team are you on? X or O?

follow culla on twitter for updates. Or maybe __acolyte__

If the non reserved tokens mint out quickly, Access List mints will have 24 hours to mint reserves assigned to those wallets

Thank you for supporting an emerging artist in the generative art space

Access List reserves were given to holders of the following PFP collections created by culla
2x for each Basqunk held
1x for each Inkspunk, TwoFourQunk, V0iD, DeeManz, Punkasso and CR0$$KULL
You would have needed to transfer the above tokens to your mint wallet at the time of the snapshot

share your tokens on social media with #genxyznft
Made with love by culla using p5.js

metadata.name: Allégories booléennes #447
metadata.description:
"Allégories booléennes" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at PARIS+ par Art Basel

This work is a continuation of research around the intersections of shapes that I have been exploring for a while. I wonder about the way in which they make it possible to bring out new compositions from superpositions of shapes that could initially represent a real disorder.

Controls:
• "a": Play the animation
• "s": Export the image (default 2160 × 3840px PNG)
• "h": Change export settings to high resolution (then press "s" to export a 6480 ×11520px PNG)
• "m": Change export settings to medium resolution (then press "s" to export a 4320 × 7680px PNG)
• "n": Back to 2160 × 3840px

Artwork by Julien Espagnon, 2022.

metadata.name: Landscapes out of my mind #89
metadata.description:
In this work, the third in the series of landscapes, I tried to achieve greater realism without abandoning those elements, also characteristic of the other works, which lead out of reality such as the shapes of the ground and trees and the choice of palettes.

Lands and Clouds are rendered using a mix of simplex noise and FBM (Fractional Brownian Motion), trees are generated with space colonization algorithm an placed using Poisson Disk Sampling distribution. The distribution density is driven by the land heightmap.


Developed with three.js using WebGLRenderer.
Rendering is faster with chrome browser.


[s] to save a png at 2048x1536, 1536x2048, 2048x2048 (4/3, 3/4, 4/4 aspect ratio)
[d] to save a png at 4096x3072, 3072x4096, 4096x4096 (4/3, 3/4, 4/4 aspect ratio)


Features:
"Palette": 14 colormaps
"Aspect Ratio": 4/3, 3/4, 4/4
"View Point":  Far, Medium, Near, Above
"Sky Type": FBM, Gradient1, Gradient2
"Sky Color": LightSkyBlue, Gray, Blue [10% probability]
"Bark Color":  Brown, GrayBrown, Gray
"Bare Trees": True, False


Created by Andrea Belloni, fxhash: anbello, twitter: @Waterflowing0. Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, see LICENSE.txt for more information.

metadata.name: Effluence #34
metadata.description:
“Through our eyes, the universe is perceiving itself. Through our ears, the universe is listening to its harmonies. We are the witnesses through which the universe becomes conscious of its glory, of its magnificence.”

-Alan Wilson Watts


---

Depending on the feature values, this artwork may take several seconds to render.
A modern, capable computer is advised.

To download image at different resolutions, press keys:

1. Low
2. Mid
3. High

---

10 first people minting at auction start price can request high-quality print at no additional cost (DM on Twitter for more details if interested)

Made with p5.js, curiosity and goodwill.

---

Daniel Aguilar
October 2022

Twitter: @protozoo
Instagram: @prtzart
Website: https://protozoo.xyz

metadata.name: Artifact #393
metadata.description:
This project is about uncovering artifacts.

Each piece is determined by approximately 15 parameters. This allows for a multitude of possible forms, and each iteration is an artifact to be discovered within the multidimensional space.

This work is focused around discovery. It is about exploring the space of the algorithm, shedding light on its many forms, and sometimes finding artifacts of the real world embedded within them.

Technically, this work is a composition of three primary elements: Voronoi tessellations, orthographic projection, and the depth-sort algorithm.
The latter of these is integral to the rendering mechanism. It works intuitively, drawing distant objects before near objects, evaluating the distance of each object according to its geometric center. It does this precisely, and in doing so, it can produce interesting visual artifacts, drawing some shapes in an unexpected order.



This has been a fascinating study, bringing light to unreal shapes and forms, and uncovering artifacts in an impossible space.

I hope you enjoy it,
Nat Sarkissian





Technical Notes:
- Append “&mag=N” to the end of the URL in live mode to specify a resolution multiplier. It will render the image N times larger than the size of your window. If you have specified anything greater than 1, a download will start automatically once the rendering is done.
